lines.text:
[Hammy's fly is down]
Hey Hammy, got a license to sell hot dogs?
[Miss Yvonne notices Pee Wee looking depressed and he explains why]

Once upon a time, there was this boy, and he knew this beautiful woman. It's not you, though. Well, the beautiful woman tells this boy that she has this secret wish, and her wish is that she wants this guy to really like her. So, anyway, the boy makes this huge, personal sacrifice and he gives his wish away.
To the beautiful woman?
That's right.
[He leaps up from his seat, clearly agitated]

It's not like the boy expects like he's gonna get anything in return or anything, but... but then he doesn't *get* anything in return; nothing happens! Nothing happens at all! Zip, zero, zilch, they're ain't nothing, no advancements, no nothing! It just doesn't seem fair. It's not like the boy doesn't have a wish of his own. Now I'm never gonna get to...
[He realizes his mistake]
I mean, now the *boy* is never gonna get to fly... I gotta go be myself, Miss Yvonne.
[He hurries out the door]
No, Pee Wee, stay here with me!

[crying]
No! No!
Oh, poor Pee Wee. Just call me Miss Bungle.
Hey, cooool! Caucasian!
[in response to seeing his new mail order hands]
They say that Karl is a bad mother...
Shut your mouth.
Well I was only talking about Karl.
I can dig it.
[Pee Wee is hypnotizing a member of the audience]

JOAN! Joan! Listen to me, Joan! You are getting drowsy Joan. Your eyelids are getting very very heavy, Joan. You are beginning to feel yourself slipping into a hypnotic state. Just listen to my voice, Joan. Ahhhh... Ahhhh... Ahhhh... Your eyelids are very heavy, Joan. You are hypnotized. Do ya feel hypnotized, Joan?
Yes!

[looks shocked]
You do?
[recovers]
I mean, you dooooo!
